description: Reto Meier shows a way to guarantee you can avoid common mistakes in your code, and also use fewer keystrokes.
title: Writing More Code by Writing Less Code with Live Templates

description: Building on a previous article about sharing an Observable with multiple Subscribers, but receiving the emitted data only once, Pavlos-Petros Tournaris analyzes Jake Wharton’s ReplayingShare library.
title: RxJava —RxReplayingShare, Emit only Once

description: The most common case you might want to track is how a certain set of data got into a certain block of code. Sebastiano Poggi shows a great way to do this without debugging your application.
title: Analyse data flows without the debugger

description: Juan Ignacio Saravia has released a series of articles on building a Reddit Android app using the Kotlin language.
title: Learn Kotlin while developing an Android App

description: The problem was fairly simple: Be able to share a Retrofit response as an Observable to multiple subscribers without the side effect of re-executing the Network Call that this Observable was bound to. The solution is in this post.
title: RxJava - One Observable, Multiple Subscribers, Same Data

description: Many developers are quite optimistic about Kotlin future for Android. Not everyone is ready to take a risk, but what if we’ll use Kotlin only for tests?
title: Kotlin For Tests in Android

description: Nabil Hachicha's slides from Droidcon SF 2016.
title: Advanced Techniques for concurrency and memory management

description: A friend asked Antonio Leiva how to implement a OnGlobalLayoutListener properly without incurring in the need of too much boilerplate. This was a tricky question because of a couple of things, let’s see it a little more deeply.
title: Kotlin recipes for Android (I): OnGlobalLayoutListener

description: For most devs, implementing reactive callback chaining yourself will prove a time-consuming and error-prone mess. Thankfully, the easy-to-use RxBinding libraries can help.
title: Reactive Android UI Programming with RxBinding

description: Israel Camacho's slides from Droidcon SF 2016.
title: AndroidDevLikeAProDroidconSF

description: Daniel Lew's slides from Droidcon SF 2016.
title: Common RxJava Mistakes

description: The previous tutorial explored how to use the Google Fit Recording API to store fitness data through Google Play Services. This tutorial expands on the topic by exploring how to access and update data stored in Google Fit using the History API.
title: Google Fit for Android: History API

description: One of Android N's new features is Picture-in-Picture mode, which leverages the new multi-window APIs in Android N. Joe Birch takes a look at this exciting new feature and how we can implement it into our Android TV applications!
title: Android N: Introducing Picture-in-Picture for Android TV

description: Buddybuild is the easiest way to automate building and deploying apps, and get feedback you wouldn't otherwise see. Use buddybuild to incorporate user feedback throughout your development cycle, and continuously iterate knowing you're building what users want. Stop cobbling together disparate development systems. Focus on what you do best: creating delightful apps!
title: Buddybuild: the world's first mobile iteration platform

description: Android developers are in demand, so shouldn't companies apply to you? On Hired, that's exactly how it works. Get 5+ job offers from companies like Uber, Stripe, and Facebook with 1 application. Join Hired today and get a 1k bonus when you get a job!
title: Hired - The Marketplace for Android Developer Jobs

description: Design shouldn’t just adapt to screen size. Context isn’t all about adding more information. These two ideas are the basis for a far-reaching design exploration that — I hope — will spur further exploration into mutative design.
title: Project Phoebe: A moonshot concept for mutative design

description: We are looking for someone to join us and make an impact right now as we prepare to launch a full blown suite of apps on the mobile platform. If you are fascinated by mobile and its endless possibilities, come join us!
title: Senior Mobile Engineer - Android
site: San Francisco, CA or Washington, D.C.

description: Yelp connects consumers with great local businesses all across the world. We’re looking for Android developers of all levels who love creating delightful user experiences for millions of people and thrive in taking ownership of the product they work on.
title: Android Engineer

description: RxEither is a port of Scala's Either for the RxJava world.
title: RxEither

description: A Material Android password view that toggles password visibility via an eye icon.
title: Passwordview

description: This library wraps the Wearable API in RxJava Observables and Singles.
title: RxWear

description: An RxJava backport of Java 8's JavaSealedUnions library.
title: RxSealedUnions

description: StrictMode is your runtime lint checks, helping you catch potential bugs before they are experienced by your users. While StrictMode has a number of performance related checks, it also helps enforce best practices around sharing files by detected File URI exposure and cleartext network traffic.
title: StrictMode for enforcing best practices at runtime

description: Ty Smith and Chris Lacy dig into all the newly announced features, discuss our impressions of our time using the N Preview, chat about what features didn't make this release that we were hoping to see and more.
title: Android N with Ty Smith

description: The Android Support library framework is the biggest boon to Android developers. But how does one makes sense of the different versions and revisions available? In this fragment we try to address that question.
title: Making sense of Android Support Library version numbers

description: More technical questions answered about RxJava. We have covered: Schedulers.computation() in RxJava, Schedulers in RxJava, subscribeOn() and observeOn(), Testing code with RxJava and Extending the Observable
title: TheContext Episode 3 (Part 2)

description: Corey Latislaw show how to integrate Robolectric into your testing workflow.
title: Integrating Robolectric 3 with Android Studio 2

description: Use and create your own Live Templates in Android Studio to write more code with less keystrokes using Live Templates to insert common, templatized code snippets.
title: Live Templates in Android Studio: Using and Creating Them

description: At DroidKaigi Huyen stops Keishin Yokomaku, Android developer at Drivemode and DroidKaigi staff member, to talk about starting in Android, take a tour of Drivemode, and discuss design considerations when designing an app for drivers.
title: Android Dialogs: Keishin Yokomaku
